items.title: Live: Nationals cannot remain in Coalition while Sussan Ley is opposition leader, Littleproud says
items.description: After quitting the shadow ministry en masse in solidarity with three colleagues dumped for crossing the floor on hate laws, Nationals leader David Littleproud says his party has been forced into an "untenable position" and will leave the Coalition. Follow live.

items.title: Breaking: Several missing after landslide hits New Zealand campsite
items.description: Several people are missing after a landslide struck a camping site at the base of Mount Maunganui on the North Island of New Zealand.

items.title: Breaking: Unemployment drops to 4.1 per cent ahead of RBA's next rates meeting
items.description: Australia's unemployment rate fell from 4.3 to 4.1 per cent in December, according to seasonally adjusted figures from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

items.title: Trump drops Greenland tariffs threat as he heralds 'future deal' with NATO
items.description: Donald Trump says he has agreed to a "framework of a future deal" on Greenland after talks with NATO's secretary-general, and he will no longer impose tariffs on European nations that had opposed a US takeover.

items.title: Debt is America's Achilles heel in a fracturing world order
items.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

items.title: Stones instead of flowers, 30 days of Shloshim: How the Jewish community mourns
items.description: On the National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, Rabbi Jacqueline Ninio shares what mourning looks like in Jewish culture, from the resonance of stones at gravesites to a month-long period of grieving.

items.title: Family of Manly shark attack survivor calls for 'positive energy'
items.description: Andre de Ruyter is described by his family as a talented musician who loves surfing.

items.title: 'Ten-pound Pom' vows to boycott UK over 'money grab' passport changes
items.description: People who came to Australia as children from the UK as part of an organised migration scheme say they the UK's new regulations for dual citizens unfairly targets them.

items.title: Live: Novak Djokovic trying to teach Australian Open 101 on day five
items.description: The second round of the Australian Open singles continues with Novak Djokovic hunting his 101st win, before Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek hit the court, while Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis kick off their doubles campaign. Follow live.

items.title: Republicans push to hold Clintons in contempt over Epstein probe
items.description: The Clintons are refusing to testify before a committee in the US House of Representatives, accusing Republicans of leading a weaponised process against them.

items.title: Children and journalists among 11 people killed by Israel in Gaza
items.description: According to Palestinian medics, two boys aged 10 and 13 were among those killed on Wednesday in the latest violence which threatens to undermine a fragile ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas.

items.title: Former NBL player AJ Ogilvy comes out as gay ahead of league's Pride Round
items.description: Former NBL player AJ Ogilvy publicly reveals he is gay in a one-on-one conversation with fellow basketball trailblazer Isaac Humphries.

items.title: Fetal heart monitors were banned from sale in Australia. This is why
items.description: Home fetal doppler devices were banned from sale in Australia last year but they are still readily available for purchase online, prompting experts to issue warnings.

items.title: Victoria's coal country set to become home of $10 billion data centre
items.description: Victoria's east is set to become home to a $10 billion data centre that will support the technology necessary for artificial intelligence systems.

items.title: 'Our AI has messed up': Tour operator offers non-existent destinations
items.description: Weldborough in remote north-east Tasmania has lots of natural beauty. But it does not have hot springs — and it is causing headaches for locals.

items.title: Live: Rate cut predicted for 2026, as ANZ foreshadows job losses
items.description: Deloitte Economics is going against the grain by forecasting a rate cut in late 2026. Meanwhile, the ASX is trading higher as Donald Trump withdraws his threat to impose new tariffs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: City real estate prices on record rebound as million-dollar club grows
items.description: The Melbourne real estate market is leading a "decisive recovery", according to property portal Domain, as the city hits a four-year high for its median house price after strong growth across the country last year.

items.title: Australia earns global praise for economic 'soft landing'
items.description: A new report from the OECD says Australia's economy is returning to normal but remains vulnerable and lacks dynamism.

items.title: Hand stencils discovered in Indonesia are world's oldest-known rock art
items.description: Faint ochre outlines of hands thought to be at least 67,800 years old are the oldest rock art yet discovered. Archaeologists say the discovery of the Indonesian cave art backs up estimates of when humans first reached Australia.

items.title: Teen arrested over alleged St Kilda antisemitism incident
items.description: Detectives investigating an alleged antisemitism incident in St Kilda this week have arrested a 15-year-old boy.

items.title: Colonial monuments vandalised, graffitied in Melbourne gardens
items.description: Vandals have destroyed a 155-year-old monument and graffitied another in Melbourne's Flagstaff Gardens overnight.

items.title: Sydney council looks at offshore dredging as locals fear losing beach
items.description: A group of passionate locals have called for a long-term solution to the disappearing sand from beaches in Sydney's Sutherland Shire.

items.title: Man City players reimburse fans after shock Champions League loss
items.description: Manchester City players combine to pay back the cost of match tickets to fans who travelled to freezing Norway for a shock Champions League defeat to Bodø/Glimt.

items.title: Hurricanes win in the rain to keep BBL title defence alive
items.description: The Hobart Hurricanes hold their nerve to beat the Melbourne Stars in a rain-shortened Big Bash elimination final.

items.title: Ukraine endures bitter winter as Russia targets energy network
items.description: The war-ravaged country has been plunged into an energy crisis as temperatures plummet below freezing, leaving millions unable to heat their homes.
